text: Students at the Advanced level (649 and above) demonstrate in-depth understanding of academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE by:

children.text: • communicating and defending solution strategies and representing complex mathematical ideas with pictures, numbers and words
• evaluating the relevance of information in problem situations and explaining solution strategies
• using measurement tools and reasoning to solve problems
• interpreting, analyzing, displaying and extending data from charts and graphs
• analyzing, describing, and extending geometric and numerical patterns
• using mathematical equations to represent problem situations
• recognizing and evaluating number sentences
• using algorithms to solve single- and multi-step problems involving whole numbers, fractions, decimals (i.e., money), estimation, measurement, and inequalities
• using mathematical reasoning and estimation to solve two- and three-digit addition, subtraction, and multiplication problems
• recognizing, extending, and describing linear relationships in numerical, geometric, and real-world situations
• determining and representing elapsed time when solving problems
• explaining the probability of an outcome and designing a probability event with equal likelihood of outcomes

text: Students at the Proficient level (614-648) demonstrate competency in the academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE by:

children.text: • using relevant data and operations in problem-solving situations, and using mathematical equations to represent problem situations
• using mathematical reasoning to read, understand, and solve word problems and to evaluate relevant information
• interpreting and extending data in graphs and charts to answer questions or make predictions (20)
• renaming numbers using expanded notation and representing whole numbers using place value notation
• applying numerical relationships (e.g. fact families and relationship between repeated addition and multiplication) to solve problems
• using measurement tools to measure objects and solve problems
• solving problems using money, including determining the number of objects that can be purchased with a given amount and making change
• rounding whole numbers
• determining the number of items in sets by grouping and counting
• identifying figures by their properties, including two-and three-dimensional objects and lines of symmetry
• understanding simple probability and predicting outcomes of common events

text: Students at the Basic level (602-613) demonstrate some academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE by:

children.text: • recalling basic addition, subtraction, and multiplication facts, and performing computations
• choosing and performing the correct operations when solving simple word problems
• creating simple graphs to represent numerical quantities
• understanding and using the information presented in a simple chart or graph
• understanding the concept of area and using visual representations to determine the area of a figure
• using motion geometry to identify relationships among shapes, such as rotations, slides, or flips
• recognizing and comparing two- and three-dimensional figures based on their properties

text: Students at the Minimal level (601 and below) demonstrate very limited academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE.
Students at the Advanced level (730 and above) demonstrate in-depth understanding of academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE by:

children.text: • using effective problem-solving strategies, including estimation, to analyze and solve problems
• using reasoning abilities to justify mathematical results, communicate logical arguments, and defend work
• interpreting, comparing, organizing, and analyzing data from charts and graphs to make predictions and draw conclusions
• representing rational numbers with verbal descriptions, geometric models, and mathematical notation (e.g., expanded, scientific, exponential)
• naming, defining, and giving examples of two-and three-dimensional figures and their components
• analyzing, creating, extending, and explaining geometric patterns
• writing, evaluating, and simplifying algebraic expressions
• using appropriate computational procedures in multi-step problems
• identifying equivalent fractions, decimals, and percents
• using ratio and scale to solve measurement problems
• using ratios and proportions to solve real-world problems
• analyzing, restructuring, and synthesizing information about two-dimensional shapes
• analyzing and explaining functional relationships and using equations to represent patterns and functions
• evaluating algebraic numerical expressions using exponents, scientific notation, variables, and order of operations
• summarizing and evaluating the probability of events and identifying possible outcomes of a probability event

text: Students at the Proficient level (682-729) demonstrate competency in the academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE by:

children.text: • using and communicating effective problem-solving strategies
• analyzing and evaluating information using an understanding of mathematical concepts
• analyzing data in tables, charts, or graphs and drawing conclusions
• determining accurate and appropriate displays for data
• applying or extending linear patterns
• using computational procedures to solve multi-step problems and analyze errors
• using U.S. customary or metric measurement tools, units, and scales to solve problems
• determining the probability of events
• selecting and using appropriate computational procedures and order of operations with rational numbers, including mental calculation or estimation
• visualizing a 3-dimensional figure based on 2-dimensional views of the figure
• performing transformations on two-dimensional shapes and using symmetry to determine measurements
• using a coordinate grid to plot points, lines, or figures
• determining perimeter, area, or volume of a figure indirectly using a geometric formula

text: Students at the Basic level (659-681) demonstrate some academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE by:

children.text: • determining what information is needed to solve problems
• using mathematical reasoning to solve problems
• reading and representing numbers using written descriptions and mathematical notation
• selecting and using appropriate computational procedures with rational numbers
• performing operations with decimals or simple fractions
• reading, representing, interpreting, and analyzing data from a graph or chart
• displaying data on a chart or graph
• recognizing, creating, and completing geometric or numeric patterns
• identifying, visualizing, and drawing two-dimensional sketches of three-dimensional objects

text: Students at the Minimal level (658 and below) demonstrate very limited academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE.
Students at the Advanced level (769 and above) demonstrate in-depth understanding of academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE by:

children.text: • using reason and logic to analyze and solve problems, recognizing that real-world situations can be modeled by a mathematical function
• performing and explaining operations on real numbers
• applying geometric terms, models, and formulas to solve problems
• using permutations, combinations, patterns, formulas, the Pythagorean Theorem, or right-triangle relationships to solve real-world problems
• using deductive reasoning to solve problems with measurements
• evaluating and summarizing the likelihood of an event occurrence
• interpreting and using a scale to solve a real-world problem
• representing and solving real-world problems using algebraic expressions, equations, inequalities and graphic representations
• determining the missing dimensions in geometric models
• using geometric models to solve multi-step and real-world problems
• plotting points on a coordinate grid
• determining the area of an irregular shape
• interpreting, summarizing, or analyzing information from statistical graphs and tables
• determining the mean, median, or mode of a collection of data
• representing statistical information using appropriate displays and evaluating the accuracy of data displays

text: Students at the Proficient level (723-768) demonstrate competency in the academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE by:

children.text: • determining the likelihood of an event occurrence
• modeling real-world situations using algebraic expressions, formulas, and equations
• performing operations (including permutations, combinations, ratios, rates and proportions) on rational numbers
• using geometric models to solve mathematical and real-world problems
• gathering, organizing, or interpreting information from statistical graphs and tables
• identifying linear, logarithmic, and spatial relationships
• using direct variation to solve real-world problems
• representing, interpreting, and extending linear relationships
• graphing on a coordinate plane
• applying geometric transformations
• determining relevance of information in non-routine problems
• using reasoning abilities to evaluate information and communicate logical arguments
• applying proportional thinking to problem situations
• perceiving and extending visual patterns
• designing a data collection plan taking into consideration random sampling

text: Students at the Basic level (702-722) demonstrate some academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE by:

children.text: • using reasoning abilities to gather and organize information
• evaluating the relevance or completeness of information to solve problems
• interpreting and solving non-routine problems
• communicating logical arguments and drawing conclusions based on data
• identifying relationships between two- and three-dimensional figures
• converting units of measurement between U.S. customary and metric systems
• interpreting simple displays of data or translating data from one display to another
• interpreting graphical representations of linear functions

text: Students at the Minimal level (701 and below) demonstrate very limited academic knowledge and skills tested on the WKCE.
